enums.name: Severity
enums.doc: Represents the level of severity associated with some problem or error situation

values.name: Debug
values.doc: An entry used for debugging purposes only. Practically insignificant.

values.name: Info
values.doc: Information about the application's state and/or behavior which may be of use. Doesn't necessarily indicate a real problem.

values.name: Warning
values.doc:
Information about the application's state and/or behavior which probably indicates a presence of a problem.
Doesn't necessarily require action.

values.name: Recoverable
values.doc:
Indicates a process failure which is either partial or which may possibly be recovered from automatically.
Doesn't require immediate action, but may be important to review and fix eventually.

values.name: Unrecoverable
values.doc:
Represents a failure that prematurely terminated some process in a way that progress or data was lost or halted.
Typically the program performance is immediately affected by these kinds of problems.

values.name: Critical
values.doc:
Represents a failure that severely or entirely disables the program's intended behavior.
Should be resolved as soon as possible.

logging.name: StackTraceElementRecord
logging.doc:
Represents a single error stack trace line.
A stack trace indicates how an error propagated through the program flow before it was recorded.

props.name: className
props.doc: The class where this event was recorded.

props.name: methodName
props.doc: The name of the class method where this event was recorded

props.name: lineNumber
props.doc: The code line number where this event was recorded

props.name: causeId
props.doc: Id of the stack trace element that originated this element. I.e. the element directly before this element. None if this is the root element.

logging.name: ErrorRecord
logging.doc: Represents a single error or exception thrown during program runtime

props.name: exceptionType
props.doc: The name of this exception type. Typically the exception class name.

props.name: stackTraceId
props.doc: Id of the topmost stack trace element that corresponds to this error record

props.name: causeId
props.doc: Id of the underlying error that caused this error/failure. None if this error represents the root problem.

logging.name: Issue
logging.doc: Represents a type of problem or issue that may occur during a program's run

combos.name: VaryingIssue
combos.doc: Combines an issue with its different variants

props.name: context
props.doc: Program context where this issue occurred or was logged. Should be unique.

props.name: severity
props.doc: The estimated severity of this issue
Time when this issue first occurred or was first recorded

logging.name: IssueVariant
logging.doc: Represents a specific setting where a problem or an issue occurred

combos.name: ContextualIssueVariant
combos.doc: Adds standard issue information to an issue variant

combos.name: IssueVariantInstances
combos.doc: Adds specific occurrence/instance information to a single issue variant

props.doc: Id of the issue that occurred
The program version in which this issue (variant) occurred

props.name: errorId
props.doc: Id of the error / exception that is associated with this issue (variant). None if not applicable.

props.name: details
props.doc: Details about this case and/or setting.
Time when this case or variant was first encountered

logging.name: IssueOccurrence
logging.doc: Represents one or more specific occurrences of a recorded issue

props.name: caseId
props.doc: Id of the issue variant that occurred

props.name: errorMessages
props.doc:
Error messages listed in the stack trace. 
If multiple occurrences are represented, contains data from the latest occurrence.

props.name: count
props.doc: Number of issue occurrences represented by this entry

props.name: occurrencePeriod
props.doc: The first and last time this set of issues occurred
